item.description:
Lucked out and got a very rare reservation (it was the last one) for fine dining at No. 9 Park on the first night of restaurant week.

Expect an outstanding meal with excellent service in the company of great dining companions.

 

OUR SEATING IS AT 9 PM IN THE BAR ROOM

 

Please check out the No. 9 Park Restaurant Week Menu so you're prepared to place your order and we are able to enjoy our meal soon after we're seated.

 

The Restaurant Week prix fixe dinner menu cost is $33.12 for a three-course dinner which does NOT include beverages, tax or gratuity.

 

You may choose only one dish from each of the Restaurant Week Menu courses.

 

FIRST COURSE

Fluke Crudo

Marcona almond, preserved lemon, harissa

Organic Mixed Greens

pickled vegetables, cave-aged Tumbleweed, champagne vinaigrette

Seared Labelle Farms Foie Gras

lentils du Puy, duck rillettes, hedgehog mushrooms

optional supplement for $9

*******************

SECOND COURSE

Roasted Scottish Salmon

fennel, great northern beans, broccoli rabe

Handmade Potato Gnocchi

housemade ricotta, farm egg, braised greens

Daube de Boeuf

Macomber turnip, bacon, petite vegetables

********************

THIRD COURSE

Buttermilk Panna Cotta

coconut, almond, mango

Carrot Cake

raisin, orange, creme fraiche

Devil's Food Cake

malted cream, coffee, honey

 

PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION:

Check out MBTA or Hop Stop to create your route by public transit. Five minute walk from Park station (green/red line) or ten minute walk from Downtown Crossing station (orange line).

DRIVING:

Check out Google to plan your route. Advise you double check that you've entered addresses correctly and included zip codes, so you arrive at the correct location.

PARKING:

If you're able to find parking on the street, I suggest you read the street signs to ensure it is a legal space, otherwise check out Best Parking or Parking Carma for nearby parking garages.

 

Before I list the Reservation Rules, please understand the NO-SHOW policy was established to ensure everyone who wants to join can and it will be fairly and strictly enforced. I want to assure you I do understand if you've RSVPd YES and on the day of our meal you have a sudden change of plans because you're lost, you don't feel well or you have transportation issues. My only request is for you to let me know as soon as possible so we don't worry about you and our reservation is adjusted. As long as you contact me you will not be considered a NO-SHOW.

Rules for Events with Reservations:

If it is less than an hour from the meal and you are not able to attend or are running late, you MUST call or text me at (617) 445-7549begin_of_the_skype_highlighting            (617) 445-7549      end_of_the_skype_highlighting.

Please be considerate of your fellow diners time by arriving promptly.

Please bring enough cash to pay for your meal, drinks, tip, and tax.

All RSVPs are on a first reply, first seated basis.

You may only RSVP YES or NO. Maybe isn't an option.

Please RSVP YES only if you are certain you will attend.

If you're not sure you can attend because you have other unconfirmed plans or uncertain transportation, please RSVP NO with a comment.

If the meal is full and you wish to attend, please select WAIT LIST RSVP. When a spot opens, your RSVP will be changed to YES based on the time of your WAIT LIST RSVP and if you answered the RSVP question.

If your name appears on the event page as a YES after the meal and you have not attended nor contacted me, it is counted as a NO-SHOW.

If you change your RSVP from a YES to a NO within 24 hours of the reservation, it is counted as a NO-SHOW if you do not contact me.

If you are a NO-SHOW for three events with reservations you are removed from the group.

NO-SHOWS impact everyone; from you, who could or has been on the wait list to the organizer as well as the restaurant's who staff based on our reservation.

An email from you explaining your absence is an expected courtesy.

If you are removed and there were extenuating circumstances, please email Tonya about rejoining.

Your feedback is appreciated so please, rate the event and venue by completing surveys afterward.

I will be arrive at 8:45 PM to welcome you from the restaurant entrance.
item.how_to_find_us: Ask for Tonya/Meetup reservation or call/text my cell (617) 445 7549

group.name: Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, & Dinner Meetup Group

item.name: Restaurant Week Dinner at No. 9 Park Sunday March 18th 9 PM
